etymology.description: Semantic 父(父) (fù, "father") + phonetic 巴(巴) (bā, "adhere") = 父 with phonetic element 巴 for sound -> "dad"
etymology.interpretation: The character 爸 combines the significance of 父(父) (fù, "father") to convey the meaning and uses 巴(巴) (bā) to suggest the pronunciation, creating an informal term for 'father' or 'dad'.

examples.chinese: 我爱我的爸(我愛我的爸)。
当太阳下山时(當太陽下山時)，爸在厨房准备晚饭(爸在廚房準備晚飯)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng tàiyáng xiàshān shí, bà zài chúfáng zhǔnbèi wǎnfàn.
examples.english: When the sun sets, dad prepares dinner in the kitchen.

examples.chinese: 每个周末他都会带爸去钓鱼(每個週末他都會帶爸去釣魚)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè zhōumò tā dūhuì dài bà qù diàoyú.
examples.english: Every weekend, he takes his dad fishing.
